Such an amazing game, but beware this will game will be toxic ;) As much as being a killer to survivor, you can be toxic also to others ;) But just be patient, cause once you get the hang of it, you shall become toxic ;)
Only the strong survive because its SURVIVAL OF THE FITTEST and you will see who is S*** and who is toxic nothing in between hahaha ;) You will enjoy it and meet a lots of great and wonder people! Just get the game, you will enjoy it! ;) If you have broken a controller over a game or punched a hole in the wall trying to be like the cool aid man, or like to be a bully, or have anger issues, this is definitely for you buddy! Especially playing as your favorite killer, murdering anyone who gets in your way! It will satisfy your killer needs! ;)

It’s really fun with friends and the chases are exhilarating, the sense of tension is constant and you really need to strategize to get the better of the killer or the survivors. The amount of crossovers from films and games is great as well, so over all a fun game, but more so with friends.
Now with that said, the balancing of the game and the hitboxes are sometimes garbage and can lead to some very frustrating times, also the time wait for matches can be extremely slow, so be warned.

This game is truly the definition of a love and hate relationship. Survivor is only really fun with friends and if you do plan on playing solo then good luck. You will either be blessed with walking potatoes or god tier teammates, there is no in between. As for killer, all I will say is that it was much more enjoyable 2 or 3 years ago. I recently gave up on playing as killer just due to the fact of how stressful the games can be. The only time I find myself playing killer is for my daily quests which by the way seem to lean more towards killer than survivor. I had at least 1,000 hours in this game on Xbox before permanently switching to PC so I certainly do enjoy it enough to keep coming back, but it does have its days. Just try to stay positive and don't let the many toxic players ruin your experience and decide for yourself if this game is worth your time.

Good game :)

I am heavily conflicted about this game, after some further thought I don't think I can recommend it, by all means this is one of my favorite games and I love it and even though I gave a negative review, I will continue to play it, let me explain why, at this point the flaws and negatives of this game heavily outdo the positives, in my opinion the game is fun in both sides but has many flaws that one can't simply ignore, first of the higher you go on skill the less killers become viable and the more the meta drowns other styles of play, I am not there but have seen and heard how it gets, I have found myself purposely at a mid to low skill level by handicapping myself with arbitrary rules to keep me there making it so I can't do my full skill potential and don't advance in skill on the MMR system, there goes my second point, the system is trash, before there was a grade rank system which by all means was not perfect but was way better, right now the only way the game tracks skill is by kills and escapes, which is a terrible metric for both survivor and killer, it doesn't take into account the thousand things that can happen on a match, this system encourages dirty play and selfish play as it is the only thing rewarded, by this system a killer that killed two survivors and stayed on their face on the hook to make sure they can't be rescued and just stays there is counted as more skilled than a killer that hooked everyone 2 times and got them 1 hook state away from death, a really bad system, the developers truly do not care or understand their game, there goes my next point, the lead developer compared the game to hockey, they don't understand their game or listen to the community, there have been bugs that have been here for a long time, as an example a sound bug with nemesis, the sound of the killer retracting his tentacle is played globally instead of only for the killer, how hard can that be to fix? this sound bug has been on the game for a while already and it has not been fixed, the developers have their priorities mixed and worse they don't know what they are doing, pushing patches with arbitrary nerfs and bufs and a mess overall, another aspect I don't like of the game is the monetization but that can be ignored as it is not a big issue like the rest of things, cosmetics and killers are paid, I can understand and find no issue with the licensed ones and at least you can grind to unlock the non licensed killers and some cosmetics but I find wrong that a paid game also has cosmetic items that are paid with real life currency when I already bought the game, but not a really big issue, that one can be ignored unlike the previous ones and the next ones to follow, now the biggest issue, the game is a cheater playground, it is not as bad as other games that are infested as they are rare at least for the blatant ones, but the fact that they are there is concerning, and they are not new, they have been there since around 2020 or maybe even earlier, not that I noticed earlier so can't say, they are rare but are there, the game is also really grindy, the grind is massive to unlock perks in characters the more characters you get but I personally don't mind it as much but I believe it is worth mentioning

I simply cannot recommend this game, which is a shame as it is really fun but oh well what can one do, if you can look past all the issues then go ahead and get the game but I think you shouldn't even bother, the issues are big after all

This game has completely alienated the idea of having a newer player base while continually adding new paid DLC content which further extends the gap between a new player and a player who has sunk well over the 500+ hrs to unlock most abilities and resources. 

TL:DR There's a lot of grinding involved with unlocking abilities to be cross character and there's a decent hacker problem that the devs refuse to address. Also a ranked system that resets monthly that (under recent stats) resets everyone to base, which can force less experienced players to be faced with the top 5 ranks. 

The Grind: 

To explain the grind a bit more in detail: Each character has 3 set abilities that they start with and 4 slots to equip abilities in. To unlock/upgrade abilities you must spend points (blood points) earned from every game to spend in an ability web (bloodweb) which will randomly have a new ability or an upgraded version of an ability already had on that character. 

Every character has their own webs and abilities, and the only way to unlock these abilities to be placed on other characters is to raise the character to level 30/35/40 to unlock their teachable ability, which allows that specific ability to appear in other character's bloodwebs. After obtaining the teachable, you must collect the ability within the other character's bloodweb in the remaining pool of moves. This is for both Survivor and Killers. 

Every character is like this, and if you're not willing to shell out the money to purchase character packs, non-licensed characters can be purchased with special shards earned from leveling in the game, and a 4 perk store that allows you to purchase the teachable of a perk to be added to your pool (2 survivor and 2 killer perks, but purchased one at a time.)

The accessibility to be on the same playing field as a player with these other resources available due to time in the game (not to mention the skill curve) can leave more to be desired from a general entry point. Pairing this with the disadvantage that Killers also suffer from not having base access to add ons (useable items that can minorly or majorly change the fundamentals of their killing kits) outside of using them once from their bloodwebs then having to spend more bloodpoints in hoping to get more basic buffs is very disheartening... especially when survivors can, on some occasions, find decent items and survive to take the item into their main pool (medkit, flashlight) to use in another match. 

I would only recommend this if you have 5 people you'd want to play with and have fun as the "kill your friends" setting basically unlocks everything for everyone in terms of abilities and allows you to experiment and have fun... but other than that, don't bother. There are other, similar games, with probably the same player base as of recent months the queue times have been growing longer and longer.

Bueno, esta va a ser una reseña larga supongo porque a pesar de que me guste el juego tengo muchísimas quejas. Voy a dar mi opinión desde dos perspectivas, la de superviviente y la de asesina.

Empiezo con la de superviviente: Tener compañeros buenos parece un regalo de los cielos ya que la mayoría son tóxicos que al final te arruinan las ganas de jugar sin razón alguna.
También les pueden tocar asesinos super tuneleros y campers que no te van a dejar NI caminar en paz por un bendito segundo, EJ: Bubba. No esperen nada de los Bubba, créanme.

 Hace una semana me toco jugar con una compañera que me body bloqueo para que me maten y luego en otra ocasión me apareció un compañero que no hizo nada en toda la partida y cuando termino me empezó a decir que jugaba re mal y no hice nada. Si, lamentablemente si te compras el juego te recomiendo que no esperes lo mejor de parte de los compañeros. 

Luego pasando a mi experiencia como asesino, soy main ghostface y me encanta usarlo pero siempre tengo la hermosa mala suerte de encontrarme puras partidas pre made o gente en si toxica por razones que yo desconozco. Las pre made son geniales de jugar porque te encontras gente que SI sabe jugar y disfruta hacerlo, la gracia ya se va cuando todo lo que jugas son pre mades.
Una vez me toco una en donde era todo el team brazuca y estaban haciendo premade, estuvo buena pero al final de la partida me dijeron que jugaba mal y se rieron de mi manera de jugar, yo no entendía porque me dijeron eso si hasta GG les dije a los wachines. 
Una cosa que si debo recalcar, si les llama la atención jugar de asesino tengan en cuenta que el juego esta mas del lado de los supervivientes, por lo que les recomiendo buscar buenas build y estrategias.

Llegando al final, es un juego buenísimo pero el problema grave es la gente que lo juega, tienen que bajar un cambio y aprender a tratar un poco mejor a los demás (Aunque veo que es mucho pedir) :/

Having played this game since its release in 2016 I can say in all honesty that I can wholeheartedly recommend it. I think that there's already enough reviews on its gameplay and how killers and survivors interact (actually there's tons of different interactions and playstyles for killers but to some degree for survivors as well which can simply not be compressed into a single review). For this reason I'd like to point out something that I only realized recently when I talked to some friends who only started playing this game very recently: What started as a very niche and fresh type of game setting with its asymmetrical playstyle that feel like two different games combined into one slowly grew into a franchise that is reaching thousands of new people every day. If this shows anything at all it's the developers' dedication and heart they bring into the game: they keep mixing up its gameplay, balance it out whenever a significant issue arises and overall show a love for their game by consistently updating and upgrading it to the best of their efforts. As with all developers their best effort might not always be exactly what the community suggests - and this community sure is an extremely nitpicky one. However, when you take a step back and really look at where this game started and what it turned into there's no denying the developers have made a lot of good decisions and are continueing to do so going forward.

The first problem, that ruins otherwise great idea, is a bad netcode. For a game, that need good timing and calculated actions, the netcode is awful – you can get a hit while being very far from the actual danger, or get a lag while making something, that needs timing and precision. 
But the second but is even more severe - while it still can be a very satisfying game experience for a hardcore player, or someone who could invest hundreds of hours, I cannot recommend it for a casual player. And not because the game, itself, is too hard. The real problem is a matchmaking, which is a total piece of s#it. The game is real fun, when it lets you to play against players of your own level – but it almost never happens. Usually, you will find yourself playing against people many levels above you, without a slightest chance to win or even get a satisfying game session. 
So, overall, from my experience, I cannot recommend this game.

So this is a bit difficult. 

In general, I like the intention behind this game. A 1v4 is a pretty good idea to make a game on, if you know what you do. And that's where the problem begins. BHVR has absolutely no clue on what they are doing. They even compared this asynchron 1v4 game to a linear game of hockey. Then this game has EAC injected in it, that by itself is not a sin, but the way it's injected is definedly a sin. All it checks is if you modded the game files (except for graphics for perks, portraits and so) and the prior and later game chat. Hackers have easy access to the game in a way, that it is really frustrating. You can get away with basicly everything, since nobody can really report you, because that feature isn't working. Again, it's impossible to report someone through the game, because they can't do anything with it, because they implemented EAC so badly. The next is SBMM, which is probably the second worst thing that happened to this game. The perks are completely unbalanced, at the to of the ranks are literally almost only hackers or dirty idiots playing this game as they are playing against the toxiest of the toxic with the most annoying perks and add ons just to fuck up people, making them regret every decision to have bought this game. 

And somehow I still like to play it. Yes, it can be a good game, if you get people on your level, but the ranks don't define you or your skill in any way. I wish killers would play with builds they'd like to play against and not with the top tier stuff. 

So I like it in a way, I hate the way it's being developed by BHVR like everybody here does, I'll leave you to decide whether it's a good game or not, I really can't say it, but I'll have too, so I'll tick recommend.

Dead By Daylight pode não ser mais criativo, mas ainda impressiona. Jogar no controle melhora um pouco a experiência e aproveitar as partidas, seja na pele do assassino ou dos sobreviventes, continua tão divertido quanto antes. O game faz grande esforço em ser variado, com cenários gerados aleatoriamente, e muito conteúdo personalizável. Porém, ainda há pequenos bugs visuais e, no geral, ele é bem mais divertido só quando jogamos com um grupo conhecido de pessoas.
